website_summaries.verdict: Users are surprised by how good the sound quality is given the price, but it probably won't impress those used to expensive headphones.
pros: Surprising sound quality, given the price range
Adjust the headband to suit you
cons: These headphones are made of plastic and may break if dropped

customer_reviews.title: Nope. Not worth it at even half the price.
customer_reviews.text: Here's clear case where Amazon reviews don't tell the true story. I bought 8 of these to use in my classroom where I facilitate beginning music production. I'm so glad I tried a pair before handing these out to my students as they are embarrassingly bad. Even against Amazon Basic's headphones which are around $15 I believe, these sound muddy. Like you are listening underwater. Avoid 'em and spend a bit more for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Aakash Desai

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, great for small heads!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too picky about sound. I just wanted some comfortable headphones to use with my digital piano so that I don't bother the neighbors. I am VERY satisfied with these. I honestly pull them off whenever I'm wearing them at first to make sure that the piano isn't still playing aloud. Sound quality for me is great. Can't believe they were so inexpensive. Also, I have a pretty small head and I was really worried that these would fall off of me. They're adjustable and fit me great with plenty of room to fit a bigger head. Comfy and secure!
customer_reviews.author: Island Pediatrician

customer_reviews.title: Beats by Dre vs. Behringer HPM1000
customer_reviews.text: Lets start off with the price ... $17 which included tax , shipping and handling. I will say this . These headphones have a better sound quality then my old Beats by Dre $349 headphones. This is no exaggeration. By no means are these headphones state of the art but price and sound quality are very good . its a clean , clear , balanced sound in comparison to my Beats which sounded kind of muffled and flat almost mono tone lol.....
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL ROSADO

customer_reviews.title: Do the job, but cheap
customer_reviews.text: I am literally wearing these headphones right now as I write this review. I predominantly use them for editing audiobooks, but occassionally listen to music with them. How do they hold up? As other reviewers have mentioned, they feel quite cheap and poor quality; but as of right now they are serving their purpose and are great for audiobook editing. I've had them for about a month, but I question if they will still be working in the next 6 months because of the poor quality. We'll see...
customer_reviews.author: J Dubster

customer_reviews.title: Bah! DOA.
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. I did not get any sound out of the left side, which struck me as odd since that's the one with the cable. I tried it with my phone, computer, and television, same thing each time. Thankfully Amazon allowed me to return it. They did feel very lightweight, so I could imagine wearing them for an extended period of time would not be an issue, which earned them a second star. They are kind of ugly and clunky, with the company's name in big bright letters across the top of the headband -- something you can't see in the pictures -- but for ten bucks what do you want?
customer_reviews.author: Frank G.

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if these are the best headphones in the world or not, but they last a really long time. The cord is thick so they almost never get a short. I had one pair get a short (only playing in one ear) after about 2 years. The second pair got damaged during a move, which was my fault, but they also had been working for about two years. I wear them doing manual labor so they get used a lot and don't break. For the price, they are the best headphones I've seen so far.
customer_reviews.author: Merovie

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Here's what I like most about these headphones that I haven't seen in other reviews: they come with a THREADED adapter that converts the mini plug to 1/4-inch. That means the 1/4-inch plug is like a solid, single unit. I've had trouble with converters before becoming loose with wear/age and not always connecting well. Sound quality and comfort are fine for what my wife and I use them for -- watching TV. Also pretty good for music. Being realistic, they are not as good (comfort or sound) as the $50 headphones I tried at a brick-and-mortar, but then they don't cost $50. For what I paid ($13 USD) a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: shutterbug

customer_reviews.title: These are my goto headphones for casual listening and home studio mixes
customer_reviews.text: About three years ago I had a set of Behringer HPM1000 headphones and through continual daily use, they wore out. Now I’m on my second set and am very happy with the new HPM1000 headphones which have a similar design. And in three years when these wear out, I hope to purchase a third set. You can’t beat quality of these headphones for the price, and they rest well on my head. I don’t need fancy headphones and I don’t care if they’re noise cancelling or not. A good low-cost headphone with good sound and reasonable durability with daily use is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Not typical headphones
customer_reviews.text: These at not what you might think so understand that these phones are NOT for gamers...they are not for connecting to you laptop and listening to the latest CD. These are for use in recording music. They are flat; not made to be equalized for listening to CD's, MP3's but to aid a recording artist (home) in overall sound mixing and mastering. They are however light, plastic almost cheap feeling, relatively comfortable. I did not feel like they fit extremely well on my ears but for the price they got the job done. Would probably buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mark vanburen

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.  The sound in unlike any headphones I have exerienced.
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike posting a negative review, but....these headphones were just bad from the first listening. The sound is very strange, and unlike any other headphones I have experienced. Perhaps they have a dedicated purpose. Don't know. I just know that it's like listening to a conversation across the room. The sound, to my ears, was just not distinct, and was louder on one side, even though I reversed left with right...not distinct and louder on one side. Didn't matter if I was listening to music with them, computer use, or any other way. Just can't recommend this particular earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Enthusiasm enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: good for everything...
customer_reviews.text: i finally had to buy a new pair of headphones...it's been around 7 years since i got the pair that just failed. Same model number, same headphones. They are that good. Cheap...i use them for recording at home. They are very good for the money. Behringer is good anyway. So, here's to another 7 or more years, when i'll most likely buy the same pair again.
customer_reviews.author: denny hanley

customer_reviews.title: Behringer HPM 1000 headphones
customer_reviews.text: Behringer is a name known in the music industry, these are no exception. They work well and adjust to fit a big head like mine. the plug is 3.5mm and has a screw on adaptor to 1/4 TRS male stereo plug, so you don't have to buy a adaptor because I only use 1/4 TRS male to 1/4 TRS female extension cable 25 ft long. I don't like the Bluetooth operation with batteries to charge. Cables always work for me better. The over the ear headphone cans isolate outside sound, and for the $12.99 they are not high end, but they sound fine for listening to late night TV or music.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P.

customer_reviews.title: ... audio engineer and audiophile and I cannot believe how great these sound and feel for this price
customer_reviews.text: I'm an audio engineer and audiophile and I cannot believe how great these sound and feel for this price. You kidding me here? This is the deal of the century. Sure you can spend $50, $80, $100, $120, etc and do better.....but wow if you have a small budget these are the best thing out there under $45 I can 100% guarantee. I've used dozens of headphones, these are mind blowing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Look At My Horse

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 pairs for my young boys and wife to use. My boys are not gentle with them (nor is my wife). They so far have lasted a solid month with no problems and not breaking. For an adult, they are "good" over-the-ear headphones. They are comfortable and do their job. They certainly are not to be compared to something in the $50+ price range, but for my boys they are awesome and lasted. I previously purchased 2 pairs of $6.99 headphones off Amazon and was disappointed because they hardly lasted a week - they were garbage. I had low expectations for these since they were only $3 more, but these have exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: BeachGuy

customer_reviews.title: Ok for a back-up pair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a second to my more expensive bluetooth headphones. These headphones are not bad for $10 bucks. They are comfortable and lightweight. The sound doesn't blow you away, but they do have decent bass and clarity. They're about what I expected for the price and would buy them again. I would give them 4 stars if they were a little louder. I'm not disappointed with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: jjster2

customer_reviews.title: great sound at very affordable price, very durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought 5 pairs of these headphones. We had a DJ company and bought the first pair to temporarily replace an expensive pair that had quit, we like these Behringer better than what we were using at a much higher price, as those expensive ones broke down we replaced them with the inexpensive Behringer. They sounded great for our application and they all were still working when I sold the business, I just bought a pair for my personal use, great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: rudy benki

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product--Short Life
customer_reviews.text: I'm re-reviewing this in that it just died on me today. Over the months I've owned this there have been surprisingly few problems. The worst was the embarrassingly short cord. My favorite thing about these is that they don't have that horrible booming bass so speaking parts on the videos are easy to understand. The over-the-head distance is great too! It's the first time I've had one that was short enough for me. Frankly I would have left it at a higher star rating but this one just didn't last. I expect my electronics to last. I guess I'm spoiled. I own apple tech.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sackinger

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Worked alright the first time I used them. I bought them to use with my phone (Samsung Galaxy) to listen to my workout playlist while at the gym, hoping they would cancel some of the other noises but that was not the case. In terms of sound quality, they're perhaps slightly more disappointing than of those that were included with my phone but offer more comfort. Not sure if something is wrong with they're cord or plug-in contact piece because the volume keeps going up and down without me pressing anything... Overall, expected a lot better despite the price since everyone else's reviews were great on average.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeless

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for the price. Fairly lightweight and the earcups fit around the ears and are very comfortable to wear. Holy moly, the bass sound is HUGE. Reminded me of sitting in my sister's car listening to her suped up sound system; it's awesome. Only issue I had was that I can't use it with my phone. Not that it doesn't work, it's just the thread part where you screw on the adapter doesn't allow the jack to sit properly into the jack on my phone when it's in its case. Otherwise, I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ladyharmonixer

customer_reviews.title: For 10 bucks you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to listen to in the office, as the gentleman I share my space with doesn't appreciate my taste in music. The previous pair of headphones I had was a pair of AKG K77s. Paid a little over 40USD for those and they're wonderful. However, I wish I could have spent that extra 30 on something else. These Behringers are just as good for a fraction of the cost. Very nice clarity, even at higher volumes. Lots of deep bass. And the over-ear seal securely blocks out all the other chatter from the background. By no means am I suggesting these are high-end audio snob material, but for the money they're a great option.
customer_reviews.author: oldwaltTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Home bound lady uses for PC movies often sleeps in them.
customer_reviews.text: Needed new, comfortable, over ear, lightweight headphones. The larger ear cushions don't smash ears. Yeah!! (My old, old ones duct taped together and too tight on head, harder smaller pads hurt my ears). So far,...just got them today, these are GREAT! Fast, Free shipping with Prime a plus! Very reasonable price for my use .They come with 2 sizes of jacks (Just unscrew the larger to get to smaller one) I am a happy shopper! Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Michaud

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for what I needed...
customer_reviews.text: I only needed headphones when I'm flying long distances - which isn't much anymore. So I was looking for something inexpensive. For what I needed, these are PERFECT! I tried these out as soon as I got them and I was somewhat disappointed by the sound quality. But I adjusted the sound equalization on my PC, and that corrected to sound. They are very lightweight and extremely comfortable. And they DO block out quite a bit of outside noise. I will say that if I needed something that I was going to use a lot, I would have bought headphones with better specifications that were truly noise canceling. But for $9.99 and free shipping, these were just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: Almost a year after purchase, still like new
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for around ten bucks from Amazon. The sound quality is excellent, overtones, subtle tones, seem to be hearing everything well .But i want to talk about the build quality. For ten bucks, these headphones have stayed pristine for over a year, much better than the Sennheiser earphones that started to shred around the ear muffs. I believe the Behringers could be sweat resistant. Great product for an extraordinarily reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably not a sound junkies best friend, but if you just need a simple ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe how cheap these are! Probably not a sound junkies best friend, but if you just need a simple over-the-ear set of headphones to watch some videos at home or play some music at work, these are for you. ALSO: this product is "glasses friendly," i.e. the ear covers are soft enough such that they are not squeezing the ends of your glasses and causing a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Mxyk

customer_reviews.title: Five stars for the money....
customer_reviews.text: For what they cost, they are a good pair of headphones. They fit quite comfortably, even on my giant head. I'd like it if they were a bit more snug. And they are really light. Now, they do feel kind of cheap, but, they are cheap. I'm not an audiophile, but I find they sound great. The only downside I've found so far is, they small jack doesn't seat as snugly as it should, and while writing this, I managed to unseat it.
customer_reviews.author: ItsWern

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad adapter.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is phenomenal. Has great audio with great cancelation. Pros: Great audio, studio quality Noise canceling is very good for the price The portability and the size they fold into is great. Cons: The fit hurts after some time of use. The adapter isn’t very good. I had to use a new one that I purchased a 6 pack for on here for around $12. Overall consensus: Pretty good product and can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L. Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good performance for the price. I use this to practice piano without disturbing the rest of the house. I dont need studio quality headphones for that. Good fit, wears comfortably for a couple hours. If you're a DJ or producing music, a pair of $15 headphones will not deliver the performance you're expecting from $150 headphones. If you're practicing an electric instrument peacefully, working on your computer, basic headphone usage with good audio quality, these are a great bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: da chef

customer_reviews.title: I got what I paid for...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked great in the beginning. About six weeks after purchasing them, however, they stopped working altogether. They're comfortable and do a great job at blocking out outside noise with a nice sound-quality...but don't be surprised if you need to replace them relatively quickly. The replacement headphones I bought were Edifier H840 Audiophile Over-the-ear (also from Amazon). They are much better quality for not much more money (I paid 39.99). For me, at least, it was worth the extra money to get a pair that I don't have to replace in 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Pixi

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Both the headsets I had were lacking in one respect. The first had a cord much too short; the second had multiple breaks in the wires that interrupted the sound too often. Both sets were on the ear and became uncomfortable after a while. This headset is over the ear and very comfortable, has a nice longer cord, and allows me to easily hear my games or videos while still allowing me to notice sound around me in the room. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara N.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: In expensive fast delivery and the best part it works. I go through head phones like crazy. I never sleep so I just listen to shows and music on my iPad all night. If I go to sleep it’s for an hour or two. So I have them on all night. Eventually they break. At 10 dollars a piece can’t go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: I should have spent more money and gotten a better pair. Now I'm stuck with these for a while because it's going to be difficult to justify to my wife getting a new pair. But they were very cheap and they are very cheap. I find that these aren't as a loud as I'd like them to be (and this is after I tried them with multiple devices). They are comfortable enough to get one star and they work so they get another. But I can't get the pound of the bass from these and that makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: Kern

customer_reviews.title: Yeesh
customer_reviews.text: I also have the slightly more expensive Behringer headphones which are an excellent value. These at twelve bucks comparatively sound dreadful. On their own merits, they reproduce sound and are comfortable, so if that's all you need, then maybe you will be satisfied with them. I will let my bass player bring me back my other headphones or use these when we practice at my place.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cirillo

customer_reviews.title: A  Good Value.....Good Tonal Quality
customer_reviews.text: At first I was leery about buying some cheap headphones for my walkman. But I was impressed with the quality construction and sound. Am playing some orchestral music -----sounds good. These cans lack some highs but not enough to be irritating. If you are looking for some inexpensive headphones for general purpose listening I would recommend the Behringer. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I’m an audio engineer and was really surprised by the quality of these headphones. They’re nowhere near as good as my ridiculously expensive Sennheiser HD800s, but the quality/range they produce is comparable to maybe Audio-Technica’s cheaper headphones, possibly Grado Prestige Series (model escapes me, but they’re around $95). They’re pretty sturdy as well. :)
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for a great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing! It's perfect for listening to music and do a bit of my own recording music, which is basically what I use them for. The sound when listening to music is wonderful. Professionally, I don't know how they would hold up, but they are used by several people in this house and they have survived for 4 months with teenagers and toddlers alike using them....
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars, considering its price. Definitely not worth more than that. Does not block other sounds, so that might be a plus for folks that need to monitor what’s happening around them. The sound is not as clear as my Logitech gaming headphones. ($30). This sounds somewhat hollow. I can’t see any pros using this in a studio setting.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: found it extremely comfortable (felt 'just right')
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one headset, found it extremely comfortable (felt 'just right'), and promptly ordered three more to use on other devices in need of 'small' connectors. However - and hence the four, not five star rating - the headsets are packaged with the adaptor already installed. On my initial headset, the adaptor was easy to remove, but on the three sets just received it's as if they're pretty much glued in place! My 'old man' hands are arthritic; even using pliers I was unable to free the smaller connector from either of the three new sets - instead, I've plugged on another level of adaptors - Hey, it is what it is - life goes on!
customer_reviews.author: David Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly great sounding headphones at unbelievable price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these headphones because price was low enough to destroy for use in my Halloween costume. However before tearing them apart I used them on my various devices and omg the sound from these headphones was extraordinary. Honestly, better than many much more expensive headphones we own! Almost did not want to destroy, but that was purpose of purchase. If you choose these headphones you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Below Meh
customer_reviews.text: This is a case where you get what you pay for. After reading so many glowing reviews I went for it and got this set. The left ear foam is already split at the seam and I used glue to stop the tearing further. The sound quality is far below that of the much smaller but slightly more expensive Koss KTXPRO1 Titanium headphones. The sound volume is very low and increasing it to 100% still does reach a desirable volume level.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: no difference on volume
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting some boost in the sound of the headphones, but I didn't get that the volume was better or noise cancellation around which would enhance the sound coming into the headphones would be better. They look nice and they a pair of simple headphones, I expected something a little better than the average pair, especially since the reviews and details mentioned music and mixing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Highs missing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Behringer fan and am appreciative of the high quality equipment they make available at great low prices. From my perspective these headphones don't fit that pattern. They sound like they don't have a tweeter. If I just listen with good earbuds there are highs that are simply not present with the headphones. Live music doesn't sound live. Wish I could give a better recommendation
customer_reviews.author: Oregon1974

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective pair left channel not working
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these for my computer and was not expecting them to sound like my AT professional cans. But I did expect them to at least function. I gave two stars for the fact the right channel sounded pretty decent. The 1/4" adapter unscrews from the 1/8" plug on the phones which is kind of different. If you get a fully functional pair you should be happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good for a cheap pair. Nice adapter and thick rubber cable.
customer_reviews.text: They sound good for a $10 pair of headphones (I've had much worse) but only time will tell how long they'll last since the headphones themselves feel a bit cheap. Plus side, the adapter lets me hook them into an old yamaha keyboard so I don't have to annoy people around me and the cable is incredibly thick which means my cats would have a heck of a time chewing it up and it doesn't get tangled up. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew R. Hyle

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones. They are large and cover the whole ear. Music sounds good, altho I like my music to be a little louder, and these don't fully deliver in that area. They certainly work well for audio books, and easy listening music. The $10 price tag *more* than makes up for any flaws in loudness. I do like my headphones and was really just looking for a cheap pair to wear while hubby is asleep and I want to rock out without waking him. heh \m/(>.<)\m/
customer_reviews.author: Jodie B.

customer_reviews.title: I might have been under a wrong impression
customer_reviews.text: So, this serves the purpose of headphones with a longer cord so I can listen to music from my laptop while working. It doesn't curve around the head or ears the best though. It feels cheaply made (which I guess should be expected for the price). My friends who "game" have $100+ headphones and I'm sure there is a huge difference in feel. That being said, sound quality pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy another pair of these!
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the bet head phones I've ever purchased. As a matter of fact my husband constantly confiscate them so I may need to purchase a second pair for myself. They fit over the ear just how I like and they cancel out at least 97% of the noise. Great for when you have a house full of rowdy teenagers.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Broome

customer_reviews.title: Plays loud, solid build
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the kids, who regularly shatter hedphones. Good isolation from the earcups. Plays *very* loud. Set a volume limited for your kids. I'm serious - they are *LOUD* headphones. Well built, thick wire, good connector, single side wire. Buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Will England

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They fit perfectly. I looked at more expensive ones but the reviews were bad even for ones made by the same company. I just can't believe the quality and for such a reasonable price. The sound quality is great with really good lows and highs. I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone. I'm convinced the customer reviews made the difference for me and I suspect they will force companies to start making better products if they want to sell them. These headphones are a perfect example. They can make quality products for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Old man

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy music, do not suffer with these.  Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely in the "budget" category, but I still expected better sound quality. I was willing to accept a flimsy cord, or slightly uncomfortable ear pads, or some other physical shortcoming. The HPM1000's have none of that. The overall feel and quality of build is definitely greater than their price suggests. The problem, however, is the sound quality. It is absolutely ABYSMAL! The sound is a dark, muddy representation of your source material, there is absolutely no response above 15k or below 30Hz. As terrible as they are, I'm keeping them to use at work, and if they get stolen, no big deal. Good riddance.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Better than what she's got now lol
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a YouTube junkie and the ear buds she's currently using are awful lol. She has small ear canals like me so they don't fit in her ears right but she struggles with them nectar she ain't giving up YouTube lol so these are perfect for her. They are soft and comfortable to wear and the sound quality is exceptional!! Now the test will be how long they last... We as a family go through headphones.
customer_reviews.author: M.Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected, and at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine today and I am very satisfied with them. The sound is fantastic (it comes through loud and clear), the fit is very comfortable, and the price is excellent. The only reason why I didn't give it a 5-star rating is because there is sound leakage. So, instead of being able to listen to them on the bus like I wanted, I might have to use a different pair. On the bus, you need the volume at higher levels than normal, so if I have it too loud I might disturb those around me. I will just have to test them out on my way to school. So in all, I am very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: FunkyFresh Diva

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These headphones work great and are a great price. The cord is very long which can be good but the cord also gets in the way a bit. My daughter is extremely sound sensitive and is easily annoyed by noisy brothers. These headphones have transformed our morning routine. She can get ready for school and ignore her brothers. I personally like to wear these while cleaning the house they are comfortable to wear all day long. I love that they are quality materials and construction. I believe they will last a long time and won't get broken (by my kids) as easy as other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: buyerofstuff

customer_reviews.title: Value Monitors!
customer_reviews.text: Don't knock Behringer until you try 'em!!! I got these to use as studio monitors. While they do feel like cheap plastic, they rock! They have a nice cozy fit, very adjustable. Darn close to flat sound! You won't find anything better without spending at least $80. Recommended for home studio, podcasting, field headphones
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Good value, decent reproduction
customer_reviews.text: At their price point, these headphones are as good as any on the market. Sturdily built and accurate reproduction at moderate volume. Inexpensive work horse headphones for my home studio that won't break my heart if they're broken or stolen. I would simply buy another pair to replace them. Highly recommend for limited budget creators.
customer_reviews.author: ketchfish

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER THREE WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: Right side stopped working. I just got these less than 8 weeks ago. used only four times. I want to return these headphones. They were not that good. Minimal noise cancellation. They right side totally stopped working. There is no option on their website to contact them. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it’s a really good set of headphones. However, two weeks after it arrived the right side stopped working. I tried to reach the supplier product support through amazon like normal but the link doesn’t work. Not sure how to get it replaced now.
customer_reviews.author: txacman

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is acceptable considering the inexpensive price. ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is acceptable considering the inexpensive price. The main problem with these headphones is that they are very uncomfortable to wear. The set I received did not fit well over my ears, and they have several pressure points that become aggravating in a short amount of time. I wore them for 10 minutes and then promptly boxed them back up for return. I simply couldn't tolerate them any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for adults
customer_reviews.text: Good for an adult not so much for a child my son went through two pairs of these his and mine. I personally loved them but if your looking for cheap set for a child i would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Creque

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great sound
customer_reviews.text: The headphones arrived a day early, no small feat since it was right after Christmas! The fit is excellent; I can adjust as needed; sound quality is great; and the cord allows me movement around my equipment. I am very pleased with these headphones and would order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Danny from TX

customer_reviews.title: Best headphone for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best headphones given the price. I have tried a number of cheap headphones over the years but this is the only thing that still works. I've been using this for almost 2 years and had no issues whatsoever. I'd recommend these for anyone who wants decent headphones without costing a fortune. Be aware that this comes with a 1/8" connector, not the standard 3.5 mm connector. I bought this for my guitar amp but this works fine with my phone/laptop etc...
customer_reviews.author: trusira

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not as loud as other headphones, coming out of my powered splitter. They get the job done though. Sound quality is tolerable but not anything I'd reccomend for long-term listening. Construction is all-plastic and somewhat flimsy. I expect them to break at some point but that's okay because of the price. Fools all my recording clients into feeling like they are in a fancy studio! the ear cups to NOT rotate or flex on a hinge like other models, so smaller heads might have a loose fit. Overall, good for a spare pair for utilitarian uses.
customer_reviews.author: misterhh

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice and heavy duty for the price
customer_reviews.text: Thick heavy cord, comfortable and sounds good. Only complaints are that the ear padding came off on one side (superglued back on) and I think I sortof broke the size adjustment; not sure if I was just too stupid to figure out how to make it work, or if it wasn't meant to be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Pratt

customer_reviews.title: These work. Behringer is a professional audio equipment company.
customer_reviews.text: Behringer is a professional audio equipment company. These $12 headphones feel and sound like they come from that type of company marketing at that price point. The headphones meet or exceed my expectations for $12 headphones. I will buy these again if they break. They are comfortable. The sound quality is good. They are not tight. They are not heavy. They are big. They are made of plastic and pleather. They have no noise cancelling. They do not have volume control. They do not have a microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Budget Over Ear
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cord feels like good quality Sounds for the price is good Cons: Overall loss fit (maybe a Pro for some) Top head band doesnt sit right on head Ears were getting pinched Over all not a bad pair of headphones for the kids or just to listen to different content. If you dont want to break the bank these will take care of you for alittle while. If your going to use them alot of depend on them as a main pair of headphone I would buy more than one pair. The reason I say this is cause they feel like they could break fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Downing

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, and great for use in home-school with multiple ages.
customer_reviews.text: These are very sturdy and stand up to the regular use of our family. Multiple children use them throughout the week. We use them during school time at home, and they do very well at blocking out noise so each child can concentrate. They fit each child well and stand up well to their less than gentle use.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones for a sweet price
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how nice, comfortable and not hot these are for the price. I will definitely purchase these again and would recommend them to a friend as they sound great, have a long sturdy cord, come with a phono plug adapter as well as a regular mini plug, are light weight and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: ShawneeJ

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for price
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for what I wanted. My special needs daughter won't put things in her ears. She also loses things very easily at school. I wanted a big set of headphones that she would use and that I wouldn't be too upset about if they got lost of stolen. These fit the bill. The quality is good and so far they have been durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Hamm

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for with these! (bad sound quality)
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is pretty awful, but for the price they are OK. They are made of completely of plastic, and actually, seem somewhat durable. They work as a backup set in the studio iso booth. I wouldn't use them for anything other than a cheap backup headset.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of headphones. Great sound. Very high quality especially for the price. I would highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: JesusFollower2016

customer_reviews.title: BARGAIN RECORDING HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: For inexpensive studio headphones these work really well. They don't sound that great for normal listening but when you're tracking in a recording studio they are surprisingly useful. They highlight the right frequency ranges that make it easy for singers to hear themselves. Can't beat the price. Good music to all!
customer_reviews.author: Mark KingTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Best sound quality vs 50 dollar range phones
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Flat response (even) . Lightweight. Heavy duty cable. Closed back, noise is reduced. Comfortable ear surround, albeit thin. Cons: Plastic headband is thin, i may last a year or may last a month, who knows. At 10 bucks i dont care, if broken or stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Don in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality is just bad in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I have had an Behringer headphone before they were great. (HPX2000), but I needed something quick and inexpensive for a short time. and plus I wanted to see what was the hype of these headphones. Short and Simple these HPM1000 are not for me. The box seem to have been open or so? maybe I got an bad one? whatever it is though, I will be returning these back.
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the average headphone user
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my computer only. They sound great for videos, Skype and gaming. They have not broken at all like some claim and I use them daily. Decent length cord. The plug base is a bit big because you can screw on larger plug for bigger sockets like guitar amps. They fit over my ears fully and dampen outside noise quite a bit. I can't hear people talk who are right in front of me while I wear these, but I can hear the door bell ring so they are not completely sound proof. Amazing price for the quality. I can't imagine you would need better unless you work professionally in music or something.
customer_reviews.author: Holic

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these headphones one star because they are comfortable, if a bit loose. Construction quality is decent. The second star is because my Mom likes them, which is a good thing since I got them for her. As for me personally, I don't care for them at all. The bass is strong but not particularly clear. The mids and highs are muddy and dull. It sounds like i'm listening to the music through a wall. These don't hold a candle to my old Sennheiser 201s. Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Ember's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of these headphones are completey GARBAGE!!!! I was excited when these came to my house. I opened the box and tested it out in my studio. I was super disappointed in the sound quality :( Its a very muffled sound with barely any mid or high levels. Everything was low low low. Don't waste your $ on these unless you just want to buy them as ear muffs...lol
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hoopes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband but find that I am using them myself when listening to my audio books. Very comfortable and they stay adjusted on my head. Soft on the ears too. The sound is good quality. No different then when I listen without headphones. I use it on my tablet so I cannot say I am discerning when it comes to sound. I would say for te price it is certainly good value and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two to test. They work great. They feel cheap because they are cheap. Monitor well, and I'm not going to be freaking out if someone drops and breaks them. But they probably won't. I'll order more of these...
customer_reviews.author: Geetar

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are lightweight and comfortable. They fit completely over the ears and block ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are lightweight and comfortable. They fit completely over the ears and block out most noise. I am not an audiophile so I can't comment on sound range, bass etc.. These are used to listen to T.V. without disturbing anyone else. They are excellent for this purpose. The only minor drawback may be that the cord is approx. 7 feet long. I use a headphone extension cable to reach the T.V.. This O.K. for me but some people may need it longer. Only had them about three weeks but, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to purchase the more expensive ones but the warehouse had these at a considerable discount. They are very comfortable, have great fidelity and bass. I am quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ostrowski

customer_reviews.title: Fair product all around
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying these for <$10 then the price is about right. They feel and sound cheep, but the kids like them. The fit a bit loose around the ear due minimal padding on the ear cup, so they do only a fair job blocking sound while using them. Overall they sound a bit thin, with not as much bass as I would expect in this size category.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good for letting your friends use in home studios
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 pairs of these to use in my bedroom studio so I could have a few extra pairs of headphones for friends to use. The sound quality isnt the Best but they are pretty good for the price. The most important part for me was having extra headphones that weren't too pricey
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a decent, bargain priced headphone to use with my computer for videos and music. These are perfect. They fit over my ears very well and are much more comfortable that the in-ear headphones I had been using. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Received and began using them today
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my nine year old son who is learning to play the keyboard. He says the sound quality is awesome and that they don't completely cancel out noise but they do a good job even with the volume at half way. They were a great price and came with the right adapter for his keyboard as promised. I expect them to last at least a couple years and the warranty lasts about that long, so for the price, I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchez Family

customer_reviews.title: Keeps his noise from mixing with my noise
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and shape, very comfy for a petite woman who's used to being overwhelmed by everything. Seems like it would adjust well for someone larger also. The smaller jack is hidden under the larger one, btw. Just unscrew it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy L. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: these headphones produce poor sound and have a cheap feel that kind of ...
customer_reviews.text: these headphones produce poor sound and have a cheap feel that kind of matches the price, so I was not disappointed. I kept the headset for the event of an emergency because I found them very light and easy on the ears, and because the 1/4inch cord was long and EMI-free
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Ok buy
customer_reviews.text: For what you're paying for these you getting your money's worth but they only last about 2 to 3 months if you use in them everyday or every other day the ear cushion fell off cool by if you just using it for your phone nothing else
customer_reviews.author: MrsLane

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable; affordable; bang for buck!!
customer_reviews.text: These are good headphones. They may not be the best on the market, but I’ve had someone try them on and asked him how much he thought it was worth, and he guessed $50 supprized to know it was only $10. I promise I’m not making this up. I enjoyed these headphones and they are great bang for buck.
customer_reviews.author: RET_22

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great sound, they work and keep working
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent headphones, they're a little bulky but my kids and I love que quality of the sound output. I had bought some other headphones for my kids but they only lasted a few weeks, the plug malfunctioned and we had to toss them away. We've had these headphones for about half a year and they are still working perfectly, we love them.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my podcast and was actually expecting it to be of crappy material and flimsy but surprisingly has been holding up since it arrived. Very clear sound love how bass heavy sound is perceived through this headphone. Also a pleasent surprise was the audio jack which was huge and fits my mixer perfectly, screws off to reveal a 3mm jack that fits into any regular headphone outlet. Very nice and versatile for anyones needs. Love the length of the cord As well. Very nice purchase will be a continuing customer.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia Corona

customer_reviews.title: For the price, they're fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: For $10 shipped, these headphones are fantastic. I primarily use them with my Line 6 Pocket Pod and an electric guitar. I did use them on a jet (Boeing 737-800), and though they worked fine, they didn't seal out much noise. That's fine, because they weren't really made for that. Overall, I think they're great.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Great economical headphones don't hurt your ears!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones because they don't hurt my ears and they have gold tips with both guitar input and smaller input plugs.. They sound wonderful.. Highly recommend.. Especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzball

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Head Phones
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable sound quality from a very inexpensive product. Not only do these phones work with electronic keyboards using the adapter (included in the box) it also works with cell phones without the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Arlie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I plugged these in, I thought that they weren’t working because it sounded like the piano was playing aloud! These are really excellent headphones with great sound quality and noise cancellation, and you’ll forget you’re wearing them!
customer_reviews.author: Mirjana

customer_reviews.title: Muddy sound no higher frequency
customer_reviews.text: It is usually the bass that is missing. It is unusual for headphones to have no high frequency. These headphones produce a muddy sound complexly devoid of the higher frequency required to understand normal speech.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, and great deal
customer_reviews.text: Great price, and great deal. But not for mixing music, etc. Good for above avg listeners, music fans. Got these as backup headphones for our recording studio and they work well in that capacity (but not for mixing, simply for vocalists and musicians to use when recording music/vocals.)
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Love

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For $11 headphones you can't beat these. Is the sound great...no however it is good considering how much they are. I am a cheap person and these are good enough. Don't buy these if you are looking for magnificent sound quality but as I said, these are good enough for the average person. I have bought more expensive headphones that sounded worse than these. Best value for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is...meh. The build quality is okay. I do like the single cord. Not a great fit for wearing with glasses (although few headphones are). Comfortable otherwise. We bought these to use in the car for watching movies in the back seat. Satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: A great pair of headphones....
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are very comfortable and fits very well on my small head. I wear glasses and they don't hurt my head or ears as some headphones do. The sound is very good as well and does block out the sound of other things a lot better than headphones that just lay on your ear. A great pair of headphones for the money. I would buy them again. I would recommend the Behringer HPM1000 headphones. Shipping was fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Allen (The Avid Reader)

customer_reviews.title: Audio "leaks", sounds muffled
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for with this product. Good for $10 headphones, but I still expected more. I used these while podcasting, and the audio "leaked" into the recording, something that doesn't happen with earbuds. The audio itself also sounds a little muffled and not as clean and clear as I've experienced with other headphones. Great, cheap option for young or casual users. Otherwise, pay a few bucks more for better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Lots of muddy low end tones. Not recommended for speech research purposes or even listening to music.
customer_reviews.text: Bought four of these to take with me on a research trip overseas during which research subjects do speech perception experiments on a computer. Before my trip I found these to be of poor quality sound...a lot of bass and pretty muddy for something like speech research that needs good sound. I guess they weren't designed for that. I also wasn't impressed with how they sounded with music. I went with the Audio Technica ATH-M40FS and love them. Very crisp, clear sound with a flat frequency response that is perfect for my research. THey would also make great studio headphones, which is what they're made for. Paide $40 more each than the Behringers but it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

product_meta.title: BEHRINGER A-B Box, Gray (HPM1000)
product_meta.description:
Color:Gray

BEHRINGER HEADPHONES HPM1000
Multi-Purpose Headphones

 * Ultra-wide frequency response 
 * High dynamic range 
 * High-resolution capsules 
 * 1/8" connector plus 1/4" adapter included 
 * Single-sided cord 
 * Oval-shaped ear cups 
 * Comfortable headband 
 * High-quality components and exceptionally rugged construction ensure long life 
 * Conceived and designed by BEHRINGER Germany 

Whether you're mixing a recording, monitoring a bass line or just enjoying an MP3, you want your headphones to deliver a wide frequency response and high dynamic range. The HPM1000 headphones provide incredible performance for a price well within any budget. 

LET THEM BLOW YOUR MIND
The HPM1000 provides everything you need for comfortable listening. The oval-shaped ear cups contain high-resolution capsules that deliver every nuance of your sound. It has a single-sided cord to avoid tangling, a comfortable headband, and a 1/4" adapter for the 1/8" connector, making it compatible with everything from your MP3 player to your mixing console. 

JUST LISTEN...
With the HPM1000 headphones, you get truly exceptional sound reproduction at a price that will leave money in your pocket for more tunes! Check out a pair at your nearest BEHRINGER dealer.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
